abstract.text: A view which displays interactive map content.
Converts a map point to a UIKit point in the given coordinate space.
Override the lighting effects mode from the map.
Converts some coordinates to a point in the given coordinate space.
An updatable map.
The camera’s current heading in degrees relative to North.
Sets one or more of the position, heading and elevation of the camera, optionally with an animation.
Removes the given user location marker from the map.
The buildings that are in the camera’s area of influence.
Returns the camera’s current coordinates.
Returns the UIKit scale (in points per metre) for the given coordinates.
The resolved mode used for determining what the colour transformation phase should be.
Returns the UIKit scale (in points per metre) for the given coordinates.
Whether layer changes are currently animating.
Adds the given user location marker to the map.
The resolved lighting effects mode.
Optional additional content inset applied to the map view.
The current span of the camera in map units.
The camera’s current tilt in radians.
Sets one or more of the camera state providers, optionally animating the transition.
Removes the specified map layer.
The possible mode of the lighting effects.
A protocol that defines methods for receiving map view updates and events.
A view which displays interactive map content.
A position provider which can optionally provide the camera’s position.
Converts a point in the given view to coordinates.
The allowable camera span range in metres.
Removes any auxiliary layers being displayed.
Sets one or more of the position, heading and elevation of the camera, optionally with an animation.
Adds the specified map layer.
The map view’s delegate.
Shapes which are drawn on the map.
Returns the camera’s current map point.
Returns the angle of the given heading at the given coordinate in radians.
Override the colour transformation mode specified in the map.
Shows the layer associated with the given building level in the map view.
Whether the derived content inset includes the safe area.
Removes and returns the map layer at the given index.
The map layers which display above the map content.
Inserts the specified map layer at the given position.
The actual content inset used by the map view, including the safe area when specified.
The allowable camera span range in map units.
The specific map data version that the map view uses.
Converts some coordinates to a point in the given coordinate space.
Returns the angle of the given heading at the given coordinate in radians.
The map currently assigned to the map view.
The possible modes for determining the colour transformation phase.
The current span of the camera in metres.
High performance map view for venue-specific maps.
An orientation provider which can optionally provide the camera’s orientation.
The current colour transformation phase.
